subject: Re: [junit] Dynamic Casting of HomeInterface
msgSnippet: Just treat Object as your abstract base class. You don t need to cast (until you want to call a specific method, and then you should know the interface to cast
messageBody:
Just treat Object as your abstract base class. You
don't need to cast (until you want to call a specific
method, and then you should know the interface to cast
it to...):

Object createDynamicEJBHome(String jndiName,
String className) {
try {
InitialContext c = getContext();
Object obj = c.lookup(jndiName);
Object home = PortableRemoteObject.narrow
(obj, Class.forName(className));

return home;
}
catch (Exception e) {
log.error("Exception:", e);
return null;
}
}
